00024 const int32 b2_stackSize = 100 * 1024;  // 100k
00025 const int32 b2_maxStackEntries = 32;
00026 
00027 struct b2StackEntry
00028 {
00029         char* data;
00030         int32 size;
00031         bool usedMalloc;
00032 };
00033 
00034 // This is a stack allocator used for fast per step allocations.
00035 // You must nest allocate/free pairs. The code will assert
00036 // if you try to interleave multiple allocate/free pairs.
00037 class b2StackAllocator
00038 {
00039 public:
00040         b2StackAllocator();
00041         ~b2StackAllocator();
00042 
00043         void* Allocate(int32 size);
00044         void Free(void* p);
00045 
00046         int32 GetMaxAllocation() const;
00047 
00048 private:
00049 
00050         char m_data[b2_stackSize];
00051         int32 m_index;
00052 
00053         int32 m_allocation;
00054         int32 m_maxAllocation;
00055 
00056         b2StackEntry m_entries[b2_maxStackEntries];
00057         int32 m_entryCount;
00058 };
